official-title.#text: To provide relocation subsidies for the long-term unemployed, and for other purposes.

committee-name.#text: Committee on Education and the Workforce

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text: Relocation subsidies for the long-term unemployed

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: may grant a relocation subsidy to an eligible individual who meets the requirements of this section.

text.#text: The
For purposes of this section, an eligible individual is an individual who, as of the date of the application for a relocation subsidy under this section—
is totally unemployed and has been totally unemployed for at least 26 consecutive weeks;
has exhausted all rights to regular compensation under the law of a State or under Federal law with respect to a benefit year (excluding any benefit year ending before July 1, 2008);
has not received a relocation subsidy under this section in the 2-year period preceding such date of application; and
is able to work, available to work, and actively seeking work.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: may not grant a relocation subsidy to an eligible individual under this section unless the

text.#text: The
the relocation subsidy will assist such individual in relocating within the United States, at least 60 miles from the individual’s current residence, for the purpose of attaining employment;
such individual filed an application with the
such individual—
has obtained a bona fide offer of suitable employment affording a reasonable expectation of long-term duration in the area in which the individual wishes to relocate; or
wishes to relocate to an area that has an unemployment rate that is at least 2 percentage points less than the unemployment rate of the area of the individual's initial residence.

A relocation subsidy granted to an eligible individual under this section shall be equal to the lesser of $10,000 or the amount that any contribution by a potential employer of the individual to the individual’s relocation expenses is exceeded by the sum of—
90 percent of the reasonable and necessary expenses incurred in transporting the worker, the worker’s family, and household effects, plus
a lump sum equivalent to 3 times the individual’s weekly benefit amount for the most recent benefit year (as such terms are defined in the State law), up to a maximum payment of $1,250.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall issue regulations designed to prevent fraud or abuse relating to the program established under this Act.

text.#text: Prior to granting any relocation subsidies under
No additional appropriations are authorized for any fiscal year to carry out this Act.
For purposes of this section—

quote.#tail: has the meaning given the term in

text.#text: the term

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , as in effect prior to January 1, 2014; and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 205(2) of the Federal-State Extended Unemployment Compensation Act of 1970
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal-State Extended Unemployment Compensation Act of 1970/s:205/p:2

text.#text: the term
means suitable work as defined in the applicable State law for claimants for regular compensation; and
does not include self-employment or employment as an independent contractor.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall submit a report to Congress that identifies, by geographic region—

text.#text: Not later than March 15 of each of calendar years 2015 and 2017, the
the total number of relocation subsidies granted to individuals under this section during the calendar year preceding each such calendar year;
the total number of relocation subsidies granted to individuals pursuant to

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: during such calendar year, and the number of such individuals who obtained employment within 1 month, 3 months, and 6 months, respectively, after the individual’s relocation;

text.#text: the total number of relocation subsidies granted to individuals pursuant to
the average amount of a relocation subsidy granted during such calendar year;
the average distance traveled for relocation by each individual receiving a relocation subsidy during such calendar year; and
the number of individuals who received a relocation subsidy under this section during such calendar year and subsequently applied for unemployment benefits.
